Hi,

I'm new to REST architecture style. As I was studying Roy's dissertation and
various other articles about REST, I realized that one of the areas where
REST architecture style is relevant is in the design of information services
in a distributed environment. I understood to a large extent the benefits of
various architectural constraints and why they are relevant to those use
cases.

Are there any use cases where applying REST architectural principles is not
ideal? I understand that a generic answer may be that it's not ideal when
the desired properties of the target system are not met by applying REST
constraints. But are there any specific type of software systems where this
is true?

Thanks,
Viswanath

--001636459184e2d411048cc75d39
